./posts/category1/a.html.headline: Getting Started with Vanilla JavaScript Modules
./posts/category1/a.html.description: A concise introduction to using ES modules without external libraries.
./posts/category1/a.html.excerpt: ES modules are built into modern browsers and Node.js. You can split your code into reusable pieces without any third-party tooling. Just use type="module" on your script tags and import/export syntax.

./posts/category1/b.html.headline: Why I Build Tools for Learning
./posts/category1/b.html.description: Reflections on why building small tools deepens understanding.
./posts/category1/b.html.excerpt: Creating little utilities—whether to visualize math or automate a repetitive task—turns abstract concepts into something tangible. Each line of code teaches me something new about the problem and about how I think.

./posts/wow/c.html.headline: Rendering Desmos States with Manim
./posts/wow/c.html.description: How I turned Desmos graph states into smooth Manim animations.
./posts/wow/c.html.excerpt: I built a pipeline that takes Desmos state JSON, interprets the objects, and renders them as animations in Manim. Challenges included mapping styling, handling LaTeX labels, and respecting domain constraints.
